Interface_name: TCP Client - side by using socket in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a TCP client class for interacting with an OpenVPN server, capable of establishing connections, sending commands, receiving data, and closing connections.

Class Description: The OpenVPNTCPClient class provides functionality to connect to an OpenVPN server via TCP, send commands, receive responses, and manage the connection lifecycle.

Attributes:
- host: str - The IP address or hostname of the OpenVPN server
- port: int - The port number on which the OpenVPN server is listening
- timeout: int - Connection and operation timeout in seconds (default: 10)
- socket: socket.socket - The TCP socket object used for communication

Methods:
- connect() -> bool - Establishes a TCP connection to the OpenVPN server. Returns True on success, False on failure.
- send_command(command: str) -> bool - Sends a command to the connected OpenVPN server. Returns True on success, False on failure.
- receive_data() -> list[bytes] | None - Receives data from the server until an 'END' marker is encountered. Returns list of received lines or None on error.
- close() -> bool - Closes the TCP connection. Returns True on success, False on failure.
- get_status() -> list[bytes] | None - Executes a complete status request cycle (connect, send 'status' command, receive response, close). Returns received data or None on error.
